ChairmanMessage.welcome: BIENVENUE À LA FONDATION AMÉRICAINE POUR L'ÉDUCATION AU LIBAN.
ChairmanMessage.p1: La Fondation Américaine pour l'Éducation au Liban est un collectif de professionnels, militants et dirigeants libanais et américains unis par une vision commune d'un Liban libre, souverain et prospère. En tant que mouvement indépendant et non partisan, nous nous engageons à démanteler la corruption, à restaurer la gouvernance et à plaider pour la place légitime du Liban au sein de la communauté internationale.
ChairmanMessage.p2: Notre mission est de plaider pour des réformes politiques, économiques et sécuritaires, en s'engageant auprès des décideurs internationaux pour soutenir la souveraineté du Liban. Nous nous efforçons de lutter contre la corruption et les influences militantes qui sapent la stabilité tout en favorisant l'implication de la diaspora dans la reconstruction et la croissance économique du Liban.
ChairmanMessage.p3: Nous croyons en la Souveraineté, défendant l'indépendance du Liban face à la domination étrangère. Nous prônons la Transparence et la Responsabilité, croyant en une gouvernance éthique et un leadership responsable. Nous luttons pour la Liberté Économique, favorisant l'investissement, la création d'emplois et la stabilité financière.
ChairmanMessage.p4: L'État de Droit est non négociable ; nous plaidons pour une justice et des forces de sécurité indépendantes. Nous bâtissons un Liban basé sur la Méritocratie et la Performance, valorisant les compétences et l'excellence du leadership au-dessus de l'allégeance sectaire.
ChairmanMessage.p5: Rejoignez-nous dans ce combat critique pour l'âme de notre nation. Ensemble, nous pouvons conduire des solutions politiques pour un Liban autonome et prospère.

IL-01.title: ÉMIGRATION DE MASSE
IL-01.label: PIB PERDU (1975-2023)
IL-01.detail: Plus de 3,5 millions de Libanais ont émigré depuis 1975. Des professionnels hautement qualifiés sont partis, affaiblissant l'économie. Des milliards perdus en investissements, salaires et entrepreneuriat manqués.

IL-02.title: COÛTS DES GÉNÉRATEURS PRIVÉS

IL-03.title: DÉPÔTS BANCAIRES VOLÉS
IL-03.label: CRISE FINANCIÈRE (2019-2023)
IL-03.detail: Les banques libanaises ont gelé les comptes et empêché les déposants de retirer leur argent. Les banquiers ont transféré des milliards à l'étranger tandis que les gens ordinaires perdaient leurs économies.

IL-04.title: CONGESTION DU TRAFIC
IL-04.label: TEMPS DE TRAJET PERDU
IL-04.detail: Les Libanais passent en moyenne 1,5 à 3 heures par jour coincés dans les embouteillages. Pertes de productivité équivalentes à 5% du PIB du Liban/an.

IL-05.title: EXPLOSION DU PORT DE BEYROUTH
IL-05.label: PERTES ÉCONOMIQUES
IL-05.detail: L'explosion de 2020 a détruit des entreprises, des maisons et des infrastructures économiques clés. Des milliards de revenus commerciaux perdus en raison de la mauvaise gestion du port.

IL-06.title: PERTE D'INVESTISSEMENT ÉTRANGER
IL-06.label: DUE À LA CORRUPTION
IL-06.detail: Les investisseurs internationaux se sont retirés du Liban en raison de l'instabilité politique et de la fraude financière.

IL-07.title: CRISE SANITAIRE
IL-07.label: POLLUTION & CONTAMINATION DE L'EAU
IL-07.detail: La crise des déchets au Liban a entraîné une pollution massive. Un mauvais assainissement a augmenté les taux de maladies, affectant la productivité de la main-d'œuvre.

bill1.title: Loi de 2023 sur la Prévention du Blanchiment d'Argent du Hezbollah
bill1.desc: Impose des sanctions plus strictes aux entités aidant le blanchiment d'argent du Hezbollah, notamment via le trafic de drogue. Elle cible les systèmes financiers plutôt que l'influence militaire.

bill2.title: Loi de 2023 sur la Sécurité et la Responsabilité du Liban
bill2.desc: Conditionne l'aide américaine au renforcement des forces de sécurité libanaises et à la réduction de l'influence du Hezbollah, en mettant l'accent sur le soutien militaire plutôt que sur des sanctions générales.

bill3.title: Désignation du Hezbollah comme Organisation Criminelle Transnationale

bill4.title: Loi PAGER
bill4.desc: Bloque les fonds destinés à l'armée libanaise jusqu'à ce qu'elle coupe les liens avec les mandataires iraniens comme le Hezbollah et démantèle leurs bastions.

chairmanMessage.p1: Tout d'abord, alors que la nouvelle année commence, je vous souhaite personnellement, ainsi qu'à vos proches, une bonne santé, une clarté d'objectif et des progrès constants vers tout ce qui compte le plus pour vous.

chairmanMessage.p4: Le Liban fait face aujourd'hui à des défis institutionnels importants. Sa démocratie, son économie et sa souveraineté sont menacées par le Hezbollah.
chairmanMessage.p5: Nous passons de l'observation à la mise en œuvre. Il est temps d'avancer avec des étapes concrètes.

michel-aoun.name: Michel Aoun
michel-aoun.summary: Ancien commandant de l'armée et chef de faction de la guerre civile. Des enquêtes judiciaires et médiatiques indiquent qu'il a toléré une corruption généralisée parmi ses loyalistes et détourné le blâme des scandales tandis que sa famille faisait face à des allégations de corruption. La présidence d'Aoun s'est terminée au milieu de la ruine économique, de l'impasse politique et d'enquêtes continues sur le détournement de fonds publics et la catastrophe du port de Beyrouth.
michel-aoun.quote: Présenté comme un 'homme fort' réformiste, Aoun a laissé derrière lui une nation divisée et des institutions défaillantes.

sections.title: ACCUSATIONS DE CORRUPTION GÉNÉRALISÉE
content: Soupçonné d'avoir détourné des fonds publics à l'étranger via des comptes familiaux depuis les années 1980, faisant maintenant l'objet d'enquêtes judiciaires.
Son gendre Gebran Bassil, sanctionné par les États-Unis, a profité du patronage politique d'Aoun pour dominer les ministères, accusé d'enrichissement illicite.
Accusé de protéger la corruption criminelle parmi ses loyalistes et d'assurer une loyauté sectaire.

sections.title: ALLIANCE AVEC LE HEZBOLLAH ET OBSTRUCTION POLITIQUE
content: Aligné avec le Hezbollah durant sa présidence, facilitant sa domination politique et militaire ; a bloqué les actions judiciaires contre le Hezbollah.
Le Courant Patriotique Libre, sa faction politique, est impliqué dans la protection des activités économiques illicites du Hezbollah.

sections.title: PROMESSES TRAHIES ET ALLIANCES ÉTRANGÈRES
content: Son alliance avec le Hezbollah et son soutien au régime Assad ont isolé le Liban, renforçant l'influence de l'Iran et isolant le Liban de ses partenaires occidentaux et du Golfe critiques.
A soutenu le régime Assad dans la guerre civile syrienne, nuisant davantage à la réputation internationale du Liban et faisant fuir les investissements.
Les manifestations massives de 2019 ont blâmé Aoun et ses revirements politiques pour avoir plongé le Liban dans une pauvreté record, l'inégalité et l'effondrement des infrastructures.

sections.title: HÉRITAGE DE CRISE ET DE PARALYSIE
content: A supervisé l'effondrement économique du Liban et l'explosion du port de Beyrouth.
A laissé un État fracturé avec une instabilité économique et politique continue.
Multiples enquêtes en cours pour corruption et négligence.

naim-qassem.name: Naim Qassem
naim-qassem.tag: STRATÈGE DE LA TERREUR & CHEF DES PROXIES IRANIENS
naim-qassem.summary: Ancien Secrétaire Général adjoint (1991-2024). Chef terroriste désigné par les États-Unis et chef stratégique du Hezbollah, Qassem est connu pour fusionner le commandement militaire et les menaces publiques contre le désarmement libanais. En tant que successeur de Nasrallah, il approfondit la portée de l'Iran, rejette tout compromis et menace ouvertement de guerre civile tout en ciblant les intérêts américains et israéliens.
naim-qassem.quote: Sur ordre de l'Iran, Qassem sacrifie l'avenir du Liban pour les armes du Hezbollah.

sections.title: CERVEAU MILITARO-CLÉRICAL
content: A cofondé le Hezbollah en 1982 après l'invasion israélienne ; est devenu le stratège le plus influent.
A supervisé les campagnes électorales, les réseaux de financement iraniens et la politique opérationnelle.
A fusionné les sphères militante et politique pour bloquer le désarmement et les réformes.
Rejette toute séparation entre l'aile politique et l'aile armée du Hezbollah.

sections.title: MENACES TERRORISTES DÉSIGNÉES ET SANCTIONS
content: Sanctionné par le Trésor américain en tant que Terroriste Mondial Spécialement Désigné (SDGT).
Lié par les services de renseignement américains au soutien d'attaques ayant tué des centaines d'Américains, y compris l'attentat contre les casernes des Marines à Beyrouth en 1983.

sections.title: RÉSEAUX RÉGIONAUX ET INFLUENCE IRANIENNE
content: Agit comme le principal canal de Téhéran, s'en remettant au Guide Suprême iranien dans les décisions du conseil stratégique.
A accru l'alignement du Hezbollah avec la Force Qods du CGRI iranien, étendant les menaces par procuration contre Israël, l'Arabie Saoudite et les actifs américains.
S'est installé à Téhéran fin 2024 après des assassinats de dirigeants, cimentant à la fois sa loyauté et son immunité sous la protection iranienne.

sections.title: POLITIQUE AMÉRICAINE ET CRISE DU LIBAN
content: Les menaces ouvertes de Qassem ('pas de vie au Liban' si le Hezbollah est désarmé) sont vues comme des avertissements voilés de guerre civile.
Entrave les efforts de l'ONU et des États-Unis pour appliquer la résolution 1701 et isoler les mandataires iraniens.
Orchestre la propagande, l'évasion des sanctions et la collecte de fonds mondiale, le DOJ/OFAC ciblant ses structures de soutien.
Les agences américaines le relient au blanchiment d'argent organisationnel et au narco-financement dans le monde entier.

nabih-berri.name: Nabih Berri
nabih-berri.summary: The longest-serving parliament speaker in the world, holding the gavel since 1992. A master of political maneuvering, Berri controls the legislative agenda and leads the Amal Movement. He is accused of turning the parliament into a fortress for the corrupt elite, orchestrating the paralysis of state institutions, and using the 'Council of the South' as a patronage mill.
nabih-berri.quote: I am the master of the game; nothing passes without my signature.

sections.title: PARLIAMENTARY DICTATORSHIP
content: Has successfully blocked every major reform bill in the last decade, including capital controls and forensic audits.
Uses his power to shut down parliament sessions whenever his political interests are threatened.

sections.title: COUNCIL OF THE SOUTH CORRUPTION
content: Accused of treating the state-funded Council of the South as a private bank for the Amal Movement.
Billions of dollars in infrastructure projects awarded to loyalists with little to show on the ground.

sections.title: BLOCKING JUSTICE
content: Instrumental in protecting MPs and ministers from being questioned in the Beirut Port explosion investigation.
His 'security police' in parliament were filmed attacking protesters during the 2019 revolution.

hassan-nasrallah.name: Hassan Nasrallah
hassan-nasrallah.tag: THE ARCHITECT OF THE PARALLEL STATE
hassan-nasrallah.summary: For over three decades, he built a 'state within a state,' commanding a militia more powerful than the Lebanese Army. His allegiance to Iran dragged Lebanon into regional conflicts, economic isolation, and devastating wars. He established a parallel economy and security apparatus that hollowed out Lebanon's sovereignty and institutions.
hassan-nasrallah.quote: We have our own money, our own arms, and our own decisions.

sections.title: STATE CAPTURE
content: Systematically eroded the authority of the Lebanese state, creating a parallel communication network, banking system (Al-Qard Al-Hassan), and army.
Used the 'resistance' narrative to justify holding onto illegal weapons in violation of UN resolutions.

sections.title: REGIONAL WARS
content: Unilaterally dragged Lebanon into the Syrian Civil War and conflicts with Israel, isolating the country from the Arab world and the West.
Transformed Lebanon into a forward operating base for the Iranian Revolutionary Guard.

sections.title: ASSASSINATIONS & TERROR
content: Implicated by international tribunals in the assassination of Prime Minister Rafic Hariri.
His organization is designated as a terrorist entity by the US, EU, GCC, and others.

riad-salameh.name: Riad Salameh
riad-salameh.role: Former Central Bank Governor of Lebanon
riad-salameh.summary: Lebanon's most notorious financial defendant. Former Central Bank Governor of Lebanon (1993-2023). The 'mastermind' banker praised as a wizard, unmasked as the architect of Lebanon's collapse. Built a network for elite embezzlement, laundering, and regime survival. Salameh's legacy is a bankrupt nation, shattered currency, and unchecked corruption with global footprints.
riad-salameh.quote: Salameh ran Lebanon's finances for 30 years, then dodged prosecution while evidence mounted.

sections.title: THE ARCHITECT OF FINANCIAL FRAUD AND RUIN
content: Embezzled $330M+ in public funds (2002-2015) via his brother's firm, Forry Associates, hiding proceeds through shell companies and European real estate.
Arrested in September 2024 on $42M embezzlement charges, bail cut from $53M to $14M.
Posted $14M bail in Sept 2025 despite frozen assets.
Ran a Ponzi scheme to prop up Lebanon's pound; $70 billion in losses.

sections.title: HEZBOLLAH & POLITICAL ENABLERS
content: Allowed Hezbollah's cash networks to thrive, turning a blind eye to illegal dollar flows and sanctioned exchange houses.
Accused of enabling systemic corruption with political allies, especially Hariri, ignoring bankruptcy warnings for decades.

sections.title: SALAMEH'S CIRCLE OF IMPUNITY
content: Raja Salameh (Brother): Sanctioned and indicted in Paris for $330M embezzlement and laundering scams.
Nady Salameh (Son): Sanctioned, properties frozen.
Marianne Hoayek (Assistant): Sanctioned for aiding corruption deals and funneling offshore commissions.
Anna Kosakova (Associate): Sanctioned for laundering Salameh's real estate empire.

sections.title: INTERNATIONAL INVESTIGATIONS, GLOBAL FALLOUT
content: Under probe in Switzerland, France, Germany, and Luxembourg for laundering $300M+ with $100M moved through EU banks, unchecked.
French and German arrest warrants issued.
Sanctioned by U.S., UK, and Canada since August 2023; Interpol red notice active.

walid-jumblatt.name: Walid Jumblatt
walid-jumblatt.summary: Former Head of Progressive Socialist Party (1977-2023). Accused of smuggling $500M abroad during Lebanon's crisis, while hypocritically condemning others' capital flight. Controls Druze areas through patronage and vote-buying, with wealth from family estates and telecoms tied to feudal networks.
walid-jumblatt.quote: Master of sectarian patronage and silent deals.

sections.title: THE KINGMAKER WHO SWITCHES SIDES
content: Supported Hezbollah's armed 'resistance,' now flips to calling for their disarmament.
Peddles deals with Syria, Turkey, and Gulf states - whoever pays to keep his Druze fiefdom safe.
Denies Lebanese claim to Shebaa Farms, sacrificing national sovereignty for geopolitical gain.
Accused of smuggling $500M during Lebanon's crisis.

sections.title: INNER CIRCLE
content: Taymour Jumblatt: Born to rule; inherits power, wealth, and a legacy of misused funds.
PSP loyalists: Masters of vote-buying, public contract abuse, and sectarian favoritism.
Party allies: Linked to cover-ups and corruption probes; influence protected by family ties.
Hezbollah & Berri: Deals built on silence, mutual protection, and deflecting blame for Lebanon's collapse.

sections.title: THE PROTECTED WARLORD
content: Linked to brutal 1980s civil war massacres, yet immune from justice under amnesty laws.
Resigned as party head but pulls strings behind the scenes.
Shapes Lebanon's broken sectarian politics to stay in power.

sections.title: THE DIVIDED STATE
content: Druze lands torn by bitter rivalries with Arslan, Wahab, and Syrian Druze factions.
Jumblatt manipulates these divisions to maintain grip on power, alienating many Druze.

gebran-bassil.name: Gebran Bassil
gebran-bassil.summary: The son-in-law of Michel Aoun and the most sanctioned Christian politician in Lebanon. As Minister of Energy for over a decade (directly or via proxy), he oversaw the waste of $40 billion on a non-existent electricity sector. He is widely blamed for obstructing government formation for months at a time to secure cabinet seats, embodying the worst of the 'clientelist' system.

sections.title: ENERGY SECTOR BLACK HOLE
content: Presided over the Ministry of Energy during the period of its biggest losses, contributing to half of Lebanon's public debt.
Promised 24/7 electricity by 2013; delivered total darkness by 2021.

sections.title: MAGNITSKY SANCTIONS
content: Sanctioned by the US Treasury under the Global Magnitsky Act for significant corruption and misappropriation of state assets.
Labeled as a primary enabler of Hezbollah's political influence within the Christian community.

sections.title: SECTARIAN AGITATION
content: Built his political career on divisive sectarian rhetoric, alienating other communities to consolidate Christian votes.
Accused of trading national sovereignty for personal political ambitions.

ali-hassan-khalil.name: Ali Hassan Khalil
ali-hassan-khalil.summary: Nabih Berri's right-hand man and the gatekeeper of the Finance Ministry. Sanctioned by the US for aiding Hezbollah and for corruption. He is infamous for refusing to sign judicial decrees to block the Beirut Port investigation and for engineering the 'financial engineering' laws alongside Salameh that wiped out people's savings.
ali-hassan-khalil.quote: The signature is mine, and I will not sign.

sections.title: BLOCKING THE PORT INVESTIGATION
content: Refused to sign the judicial appointments needed to keep the Beirut Port Blast investigation alive.
Issued an arrest warrant for Judge Tarek Bitar in a brazen attempt to intimidate the judiciary.

sections.title: MINISTRY OF FINANCE CORRUPTION
content: Used the Finance Ministry as a tool for sectarian patronage, hiring thousands of illegal employees.
Blocked forensic audits that would have exposed the scale of theft in the public sector.

sections.title: SANCTIONS & HEZBOLLAH LINKS
content: Sanctioned by the US for providing material support to Hezbollah and leveraging his political position for financial gain.
Accused of moving money for Hezbollah through state institutions.

ghada-aoun.name: Ghada Aoun
ghada-aoun.summary: A polarizing judicial figure known for her televised raids on financial institutions. While claiming to fight corruption, her investigations are widely criticized as politically motivated witch-hunts targeting opponents of the Free Patriotic Movement (FPM). She has repeatedly defied judicial dismissal orders, exposing the complete breakdown of the Lebanese judicial hierarchy.
ghada-aoun.quote: Justice used as a political weapon ceases to be justice.

sections.title: POLITICIZED RAIDS
content: Orchestrated dramatic, media-covered raids on the Mecattaf money exchange and various banks, often accompanied by FPM activists rather than security forces.
Accused of selectively targeting banks aligned with her political rivals while ignoring others.
Her refusal to step down despite dismissal by the Public Prosecutor signaled the end of judicial chain of command.

sections.title: JUDICIAL ANARCHY
content: Dismissed from investigations multiple times by the Higher Judicial Council but refused to comply, breaking locks and entering sealed offices by force.
Faces over 20 complaints before the Judicial Inspection Authority, the highest for any judge in Lebanese history.
Actions have been described by legal experts as contributing to the total paralysis of the judiciary.

jamil-al-sayed.name: Jamil al-Sayed
jamil-al-sayed.role: Member of Parliament / Former General Security Chief
jamil-al-sayed.summary: The former Director General of General Security who constructed the Syrian-Lebanese security apparatus that dominated Lebanon post-civil war. Though released from detention in the Hariri assassination case due to 'insufficient evidence', he remains the symbol of the 'police state' era, using intimidation and intelligence dossiers to maintain influence.
jamil-al-sayed.quote: The dossiers never disappear, they just change hands.

sections.title: THE SYRIAN PROCONSUL
content: Served as the primary enforcer of Syrian hegemony in Lebanon, orchestrating crackdowns on anti-Syrian activists and politicians.
Reinvented himself as an MP allied with Hezbollah, using his parliamentary immunity to attack judicial investigations.
Accused of maintaining a private intelligence network to blackmail political rivals.

sections.title: JUSTICE DELAYED
content: Detained for four years in connection with the Rafic Hariri assassination; his release was celebrated by Hezbollah as a victory against 'politicized international justice'.
Continues to threaten judges and journalists who investigate the security sector's dark history.

mohammad-haidar.name: Mohammad Haidar
mohammad-haidar.summary: A key figure in Hezbollah's security apparatus, often operating in the shadows. He is alleged to oversee the party's control over critical infrastructure, including Beirut-Rafic Hariri International Airport, facilitating the unchecked flow of illicit goods and cash that sustains the parallel state.
mohammad-haidar.quote: Whoever controls the ports, controls the lifeline of the nation.

sections.title: AIRPORT HEGEMONY
content: Alleged to enforce Hezbollah's de facto authority over airport security, bypassing state customs and oversight.
Linked to networks that transport cash and sensitive equipment from Iran, violating UN resolutions.
His influence ensures that the state remains blind to the parallel economy moving through its own borders.

sections.title: THE PARALLEL ECONOMY
content: Part of the network managing the party's financing, insulating it from the national banking collapse.
Resistance to IMF reforms is driven by the need to protect these illicit supply lines from international scrutiny.

nawaf-salam.name: Nawaf Salam
nawaf-salam.role: Prime Minister of Lebanon / Former ICJ Judge
nawaf-salam.summary: Appointed Prime Minister in early 2025 as a 'reformist hope' backed by the West. However, his tenure has been marked by total paralysis. Boycotted by the 'Shia Duo' and unable to implement a single IMF reform, Salam represents the failure of the 'technocratic solution' in a system ruled by warlords.
nawaf-salam.quote: Good intentions die quickly in the graveyard of Lebanese politics.

sections.title: THE FAILED WESTERN GAMBIT
content: His appointment was intended to unlock international aid, but his inability to confront Hezbollah's veto power left the country in limbo.
Labeled as 'The Weakest PM' by critics after failing to enforce security appointments or border controls.
His tenure proved that without disarming militias, even the most qualified judge is powerless.

sections.title: INSTITUTIONAL DEADLOCK
content: Forced to govern without a functioning cabinet due to sectarian boycotts.
His promises of 'accountability' for the Beirut Blast were immediately blocked by the entrenched political class he swore to fight.

amer-bisat.name: Amer Bisat
amer-bisat.summary: A leading global economist and BlackRock executive who diagnosed Lebanon's crisis years before the collapse. His comprehensive rescue plans were systematically ignored by the ruling elite, who preferred to loot the remaining reserves rather than implement the forensic audits he demanded.
amer-bisat.quote: They knew the ship was sinking and chose to sell the lifeboats.

sections.title: THE LOST DECADE
content: Co-authored the '10 Point Action Plan' warning of a 'lost decade' if immediate capital controls weren't implemented in 2020.
His exclusion from decision-making roles highlights the regime's allergy to competence and transparency.
Remains a vocal critic of the 'Lirification' of deposits, calling it the largest wealth transfer from the poor to the rich in history.

sections.title: TECHNOCRATIC EXILE
content: Represents the diaspora talent pool that Lebanon desperately needs but refuses to empower.
His warnings about the Central Bank's Ponzi scheme were dismissed as 'pessimism' until the savings of millions evaporated.

fadi-akiki.name: Fadi Akiki
fadi-akiki.role: Government Commissioner to the Military Court
fadi-akiki.summary: The judicial hammer of the establishment. As the head of the Military Court, Akiki is accused of weaponizing military justice to target activists, protesters, and religious figures critical of Hezbollah, while burying investigations into militia violence like the Tayyouneh clashes.
fadi-akiki.quote: In the military court, orders from above weigh more than the law.

sections.title: TARGETING DISSENT
content: Infamously detained Archbishop Moussa al-Hajj, confiscating aid for the poor in a move seen as intimidation of the Church.
Routinely summons activists and journalists for 'insulting the presidency' or 'disturbing the peace,' effectively criminalizing free speech.
Criticized by human rights groups for using broad 'terrorism' charges to detain peaceful protesters.

sections.title: SELECTIVE JUSTICE
content: Accused of stalling investigations into the killing of UNIFIL peacekeepers to protect Hezbollah-linked suspects.
His tenure cemented the Military Court's reputation as a tool for political repression rather than national security.

najib-mikati.name: Najib Mikati
najib-mikati.summary: Lebanon's richest man and perennial Prime Minister. While his home city of Tripoli sank into extreme poverty, Mikati's wealth soared. Implicated in the Pandora Papers and subject to money laundering investigations in France, he represents the collision of private profit and public office.
najib-mikati.quote: Business as usual, even while the country burns.

sections.title: GLOBAL INVESTIGATIONS
content: Under investigation by French prosecutors since 2024 for money laundering and illicit enrichment involving offshore assets.
Named in the Pandora Papers for using tax havens to purchase property in Monaco while Lebanon's economy collapsed.
Accused of benefiting from subsidized housing loans meant for the poor to acquire luxury real estate.

sections.title: CONFLICT OF INTEREST
content: His telecom empire was built on state monopolies awarded during the Syrian occupation era.
As PM, he was accused of delaying necessary banking reforms to protect the interests of the bank-owning political class, including himself.

paul-morcos.name: Paul Morcos
paul-morcos.summary: The smooth-talking legal face of the establishment. Often appearing on TV to defend the banking sector's 'rights' and justify the blocking of forensic audits. Appointed Minister of Information in 2025, he uses his legal expertise to draft loopholes that allow the elite to evade accountability.
paul-morcos.quote: He finds the legal clauses that let the guilty sleep at night.

sections.title: DEFENDING THE INDEFENSIBLE
content: Argued that 'Banking Secrecy' prevented forensic audits, providing the legal cover for Riad Salameh's obstructionism.
Founder of a legal consultancy that advises the very banks holding depositors' money hostage.
His appointment as Minister was seen as a move to control the narrative and suppress leaks about government corruption.

sections.title: LEGAL GYMNASTICS
content: Master of the 'committee solution'—proposing endless legal committees to delay urgent reforms until international interest fades.
Drafted capital control proposals that legalized the theft of deposits while protecting bank shareholders.

alain-bifani.name: Alain Bifani
alain-bifani.summary: The second-highest financial official who resigned in protest in 2020. He was the first to officially expose the 'Ponzi scheme' run by the banks and the Central Bank. Vilified by the establishment for revealing the scale of losses, he accuses the ruling class of choosing to implode the economy rather than admit bankruptcy.
alain-bifani.quote: They chose to sacrifice the people to save the banks' shareholders.

sections.title: EXPOSING THE LOSSES
content: Architect of the government's 2020 recovery plan that first quantified the $69 billion hole in the financial sector.
Accused the banking association and parliament of 'organized denial' to sabotage negotiations with the IMF.

sections.title: SYSTEMIC COLLUSION
content: Testified that politicians and bankers conspired to smuggle their own money out of the country while freezing small depositors' accounts.
His resignation signaled the end of any internal attempt to fix the system from within.

ghazi-zeaiter.name: Ghazi Zeaiter
ghazi-zeaiter.role: MP / Former Minister of Public Works
ghazi-zeaiter.summary: A central figure in the Beirut Port explosion investigation. As the former Minister of Public Works, he oversaw the port during the period the ammonium nitrate was stored. He has become the face of 'parliamentary immunity,' refusing to appear for questioning and suing the judges who try to investigate him.
ghazi-zeaiter.quote: Immunity is my right, and I will not waive it.

sections.title: WANTED FOR QUESTIONING
content: Issued an arrest warrant by Judge Tarek Bitar, which he has successfully evaded due to political protection.
Accused of negligence leading to homicide for failing to remove the explosive material despite knowing of its presence.

sections.title: JUDICIAL WARFARE
content: Along with Ali Hassan Khalil, he filed dozens of lawsuits to freeze the port investigation, successfully stalling justice for years.
Re-elected to parliament in 2022, renewing the immunity that protects him from prosecution.

ibrahim-kanaan.name: Ibrahim Kanaan
ibrahim-kanaan.summary: The veteran MP who spent years 'auditing' budgets that never added up. As the head of the Finance Committee, he led the parliamentary challenge against the government's own financial recovery plan in 2020, disputing the loss figures. This delay effectively torpedoed the IMF deal and allowed banks to liquidate their assets while depositors were left with nothing.
ibrahim-kanaan.quote: We need to double-check the numbers while the ship sinks.

sections.title: THE LOSS DISPUTE
content: Famous for chairing the committee that claimed the government's estimated financial losses were exaggerated, aligning himself with the banking lobby.
His actions delayed the acknowledgment of bankruptcy, costing the economy billions in lost reserves.

sections.title: POLITICAL COVER
content: A key member of the Free Patriotic Movement who provided the 'technocratic' cover for political obstructionism.
Oversaw the employment of thousands of illegal hires in the public sector before elections.

mohammad-raad.name: Mohammad Raad
mohammad-raad.role: Head of Loyalty to the Resistance Bloc
mohammad-raad.summary: The unsmiling face of Hezbollah in parliament. As the head of its bloc, he delivers the party's ultimatums to the state. He famously told opponents who disagreed with the party's choices to 'drink sea water,' symbolizing the militia's dominance over political discourse.
mohammad-raad.quote: We have the patience to wait for centuries.

sections.title: PARLIAMENTARY VETO
content: Orchestrates the blocking of presidential elections by withdrawing his bloc from sessions to lose quorum.
Ensures that no legislation passes that could threaten the party's military or financial autonomy.

sections.title: IDEOLOGICAL ENFORCER
content: Regularly attacks opponents as 'traitors' or 'western agents' to silence dissent.
Justifies the parallel economy and weapons as essential for national defense.

ali-mamluk.name: Ali Mamluk
ali-mamluk.summary: A symbol of the continued Syrian intelligence interference in Lebanon. Indicted for plotting terror attacks with Michel Samaha to incite sectarian strife. Despite being a foreign official, his influence permeates the Lebanese security and political structure, representing the 'tutelage' that never truly ended.
ali-mamluk.quote: Chaos is a tool of control.

sections.title: THE SAMAHA-MAMLUK PLOT
content: Indicted by the Lebanese military tribunal for smuggling explosives into Lebanon to assassinate religious and political figures.
The plot was intended to trigger a civil war to divert attention from the uprising in Syria.

sections.title: SANCTIONED ENFORCER
content: Under US and EU sanctions for human rights abuses in Syria and destabilizing activities in Lebanon.
Maintains deep channels with Lebanese allies to ensure Beirut remains aligned with the 'Axis of Resistance'.

amin-salam.name: Amin Salam
amin-salam.summary: Appointed as a technocrat, he became famous for diplomatic gaffes and ineffective policies. His attempt to rebuild the grain silos by appealing to the Emir of Kuwait 'with a stroke of a pen' caused a diplomatic scandal. He oversaw the 'dollarization' of supermarkets, which failed to curb inflation.
amin-salam.quote: I can fix this with a stroke of a pen.

sections.title: DIPLOMATIC GAFFES
content: Caused a diplomatic rift with Kuwait by casually suggesting their Emir could rebuild the port silos personally.
Criticized for lacking political maturity and understanding of historical diplomatic relations.

sections.title: THE DOLLARIZATION FAILURE
content: Authorized the pricing of goods in dollars, claiming it would protect consumers, but prices continued to skyrocket.
Accused of serving the interests of the supermarket cartels rather than the impoverished citizens.

ali-hassan-khalil-9.name: Ali Hassan Khalil
ali-hassan-khalil-9.summary: Nabih Berri's political enforcer and the longest-serving Finance Minister during the collapse. Sanctioned by the US for corruption and material support to Hezbollah. He is currently a fugitive from justice in the Beirut Blast probe, yet he continues to sit in parliament, shielded by immunity.
ali-hassan-khalil-9.quote: I am immune, and the judge is politicized.

sections.title: WANTED & SANCTIONED
content: Issued an arrest warrant by Judge Tarek Bitar for the Port Blast but refused to appear, claiming the judge lacked authority.
Sanctioned by the US Treasury for demanding kickbacks on government contracts and moving money for Hezbollah.

sections.title: FINANCIAL ENGINEER
content: Signed off on the financial engineering decrees that led to the Ponzi scheme collapse.
Accused of using the Ministry of Finance to block appointments and contracts that didn't benefit his political allies.

mohamad-fneish.name: Mohamad Fneish
mohamad-fneish.summary: A veteran Hezbollah minister known for his soft-spoken demeanor which masks hardline loyalty. While he served as Minister of Administrative Reform, the state bureaucracy crumbled. He is often the figure used by the party to interface with the state institutions they ultimately undermine.
mohamad-fneish.quote: Reform is good, as long as it doesn't touch the Resistance.

sections.title: THE BROTHER'S SCANDAL
content: His brother was deeply implicated in the 'Forgery of Medicine' scandal, selling expired and fake drugs to cancer patients.
Fneish claimed he would 'lift the cover' off anyone involved, yet his brother remained elusive, highlighting the party's protection network.

sections.title: INSTITUTIONAL CAPTURE
content: Ensured that the 'Administrative Reform' ministry never actually reformed the sectarian hiring practices that benefit his party.
Represented the party's interests in cabinet votes, ensuring state policy aligned with regional axes.

emile-lahoud.name: Emile Lahoud
emile-lahoud.summary: The General-turned-President who symbolized the peak of the Syrian occupation. His term was forcibly extended in 2004, triggering the events that led to Hariri's assassination. He presided over the polarization of the country and the entrenchment of the security state.
emile-lahoud.quote: I am the captain of the ship, even if it is sinking.

sections.title: THE FORCED EXTENSION
content: His term extension, coerced by Damascus, violated the constitution and led to UN Resolution 1559.
Stood by the Syrian regime during the Cedar Revolution, isolating the presidency from the street.

sections.title: INSTITUTIONAL PARALYSIS
content: Spent his final years in office boycotting the government, setting the precedent for the political vacuums that followed.
Defended the 'security apparatus' accused of orchestrating political assassinations.

fouad-siniora.name: Fouad Siniora
fouad-siniora.summary: Hariri's long-time finance minister and PM during the 2006 war. He is accused by opponents of 'losing' $11 billion in unrecorded spending (a claim he denies as political targeting). To his supporters, he is a statesman; to his critics, the architect of the debt-based economic model.
fouad-siniora.quote: We spent the money to keep the state running.

sections.title: THE $11 BILLION CONTROVERSY
content: Accused of spending $11 billion between 2006 and 2009 without parliamentary budget approval.
Claims the spending was necessary extra-budgetary payments for debts and wages during a political blockade.

sections.title: FISCAL ENGINEER
content: Architect of the Paris II and III donor conferences which piled more debt onto Lebanon without structural reforms.
Oversaw the banking policies that incentivized high interest rates on government debt.

saad-hariri.name: Saad Hariri
saad-hariri.summary: Inherited a political empire he couldn't maintain. His compromises with Hezbollah (the 'Presidential Settlement') alienated his Gulf backers and failed to stabilize Lebanon. He bowed out of politics in 2022, leaving the Sunni community leaderless and the country in freefall.
saad-hariri.quote: I am suspending my political work.

sections.title: THE FAILED SETTLEMENT
content: Elected Michel Aoun as president in 2016 in a deal that surrendered executive power for a facade of stability.
His capitulation to Hezbollah's demands led to Saudi Arabia cutting financial support to Lebanon.

sections.title: ECONOMIC LEGACY
content: His governments continued the borrowing policies of his father, ignoring warnings of the coming crash.
Resigned in 2019 under pressure from the streets, admitting the political class had failed.

sleiman-frangieh.name: Sleiman Frangieh
sleiman-frangieh.summary: The 'Crown Prince' of the North and Hezbollah's preferred candidate for president. He prides himself on his personal friendship with Bashar al-Assad. His candidacy paralyzed the parliament for years, as the 'Shia Duo' refused to consider anyone else.

sections.title: HEZBOLLAH'S CHOICE
content: Backed by the 'Axis of Resistance' for the presidency, blocking any reformist candidate.
Openly supports the 'Army-People-Resistance' formula that legitimizes Hezbollah's weapons.

sections.title: FEUDAL LORD
content: Inherited his political seat from his grandfather and father, representing the entrenched feudal system.
His ministry (Public Works) was famously associated with the corrupt 'Ministry of Asphalt' patronage networks.

jihad-al-arab.name: Jihad al-Arab
jihad-al-arab.summary: The symbol of crony capitalism in Lebanon. A contractor close to Saad Hariri, he was awarded contracts worth hundreds of millions for garbage collection and infrastructure projects that often failed or were never completed. Sanctioned by the US Treasury for corruption.
jihad-al-arab.quote: The tenders are won before they are announced.

sections.title: GARBAGE & LANDFILLS
content: Awarded the coastal landfill contracts that polluted the Mediterranean, allegedly without proper environmental oversight.
Accused of inflating costs for waste management services while the streets filled with trash.

sections.title: US SANCTIONS
content: Sanctioned for 'contributing to the breakdown of the rule of law' and using political connections to win no-bid contracts.
His projects, like the 'disappearing' bridge repairs, are cited as prime examples of state theft.

michel-sleiman.name: Michel Sleiman
michel-sleiman.summary: The President who tried to disassociate Lebanon from regional wars with the 'Baabda Declaration,' only to be mocked by Hezbollah as having 'wooden' logic. His tenure saw the beginning of the Syrian refugee crisis and the erosion of the state's monopoly on violence.

sections.title: BAABDA DECLARATION
content: Broker of the 2012 agreement to keep Lebanon neutral in the Syrian war, which Hezbollah famously violated days later.
Called for a defense strategy that would integrate Hezbollah's arms into the state, making him a target of the militia.

sections.title: POLITICAL ISOLATION
content: Left office without a successor, beginning the cycle of presidential vacuums.
His influence waned as the political polarization between March 8 and March 14 destroyed the center.

hussein-fadlallah.name: Hussein Fadlallah
hussein-fadlallah.summary: A vocal MP from the Loyalty to the Resistance bloc. Fadlallah is known for his fiery rhetoric that frames Lebanon's economic collapse entirely as an 'American siege' and external conspiracy. He represents the narrative that absolves the ruling class of responsibility by externalizing the crisis to foreign enemies.
hussein-fadlallah.quote: The crisis is a tool of war against the Resistance.

sections.title: NARRATIVE WARFARE
content: Consistently frames the financial crisis not as a result of corruption or mismanagement, but as a US-orchestrated punishment for Lebanon's support of Hezbollah.
Rejects the notion that the party's alliance with corrupt figures contributed to the state's bankruptcy.

sections.title: BLOCKING WESTERN REFORM
content: Part of the parliamentary bloc that views IMF conditions as tools of foreign tutelage.
Advocates for an 'Eastern orientation' (Iran/China/Russia) as an alternative to the West, despite the lack of tangible economic results from these partners.

salim-sfeir.name: Salim Sfeir
salim-sfeir.summary: The face of the banking crisis. As head of the Association of Banks (ABL), he famously declared 'The money is safe' while banks were locking doors. He led the ferocious lobbying campaign against the IMF plan, protecting bank shareholders at the expense of depositors.
salim-sfeir.quote: We are not bankrupt; we just don't have liquidity.

sections.title: ORGANIZED DENIAL
content: Led the campaign to torpedo the 2020 Lazard recovery plan, arguing that the state, not banks, should bear the losses.
Infamously stated 'the money is there' days before banks imposed total capital controls.

sections.title: PROTECTING SHAREHOLDERS
content: Accused of prioritizing the protection of bank capital over the life savings of millions of Lebanese.
His statements are seen as gaslighting a population that has lost everything.

albert-kostanian.name: Albert Kostanian
albert-kostanian.summary: A former Kataeb strategist turned media host. Through his show 'Vision 2030', he dissects the collapse but is criticized by some as part of the 'talking heads' ecosystem that normalizes the crisis. He represents the intellectual class that analyzes the Titanic as it sinks.
albert-kostanian.quote: We need a vision, not just a reaction.

sections.title: MEDIA INFLUENCE
content: Hosts high-level debates that highlight the government's failures but rarely lead to actionable change.
Represents the transition of political operatives into media influencers.

sections.title: REFORMIST RHETORIC
content: Advocates for secularism and decentralization, yet comes from a traditional sectarian party background.
Critiques the 'mafia-militia' alliance while operating within the media platforms owned by the elite.

marwan-kheireddine.name: Marwan Kheireddine
marwan-kheireddine.summary: A former minister and banker who became the aggressive defender of the banking sector. Indicted in France for money laundering in connection with Riad Salameh. He famously ran for parliament in 2022 on a platform of protecting depositors, only to lose spectacularly.
marwan-kheireddine.quote: The banks did not steal your money.

sections.title: FRENCH INDICTMENT
content: Indicted by French prosecutors for participation in a criminal conspiracy and money laundering.
Accused of falsifying records to hide Riad Salameh's wealth in his bank.

sections.title: LIRIFICATION
content: A vocal proponent of 'Lirification'—forcing depositors to withdraw dollars in worthless local currency.
Known for his aggressive media appearances attacking anyone who criticizes the banks.

raja-salameh.name: Raja Salameh
raja-salameh.summary: The younger brother of the Central Bank Governor and the owner of 'Forry Associates'. He is the key figure in the embezzlement scheme, accused of receiving over $300 million in illicit commissions from the Central Bank and funneling them to offshore accounts.
raja-salameh.quote: The silent partner in the heist of the century.

sections.title: FORRY ASSOCIATES
content: Signed a secret contract with the Central Bank that garnered millions in commissions for doing no work.
Arrested in Lebanon and France for illicit enrichment and money laundering.

sections.title: FAMILY BUSINESS
content: His arrest broke the aura of untouchability surrounding the Salameh family.
Used real estate in Paris and London to launder the proceeds of the alleged embezzlement.

salim-jreissati.name: Salim Jreissati
salim-jreissati.summary: The legal mastermind for the Aoun presidency. Sanctioned by the US for using his position as Justice Minister to undermine investigations and protect political allies. He is accused of turning the judiciary into a tool for political retribution.
salim-jreissati.quote: The law is what we interpret it to be.

sections.title: JUDICIAL INTERFERENCE
content: Sanctioned by the US Treasury for soliciting bribes and interfering in judicial proceedings.
Accused of pressuring judges to release assistants of Hezbollah financiers.

sections.title: THE PRESIDENT'S SHIELD
content: Drafted the legal theories that justified the paralysis of the government and the obstruction of appointments.
Acted as the gatekeeper for the presidency, filtering legal files to suit political agendas.

ghassan-oueidat.name: Ghassan Oueidat
ghassan-oueidat.summary: The highest-ranking prosecutor who dealt the final blow to the Beirut Port investigation. In an unprecedented move, he charged the judge investigating him (Tarek Bitar) and ordered the release of all 17 detainees connected to the blast, effectively ending accountability for the crime.
ghassan-oueidat.quote: In the palace of justice, the prosecutor rules, not the law.

sections.title: THE COUP AGAINST JUSTICE
content: Issued a circular ordering security forces not to execute Judge Bitar's warrants, crippling the investigation.
Recused himself from the case due to family ties to a charged minister, then returned to crush the probe when it targeted his allies.

sections.title: SYSTEMIC IMPUNITY
content: His release of all port blast detainees was described by legal experts as a 'coup' against the judicial system.
Represents the judiciary's total subservience to the political establishment.

youssef-fenianos.name: Youssef Fenianos
youssef-fenianos.summary: A key figure in the Marada Movement, he served as Minister of Public Works when the ammonium nitrate was stored at the port. He was sanctioned by the US Treasury for channeling state funds to Hezbollah and engaging in corruption.

sections.title: US SANCTIONS
content: Sanctioned by the OFAC for providing 'material support' to Hezbollah and ensuring the party received government contracts.
Accused of prioritizing party loyalty over public safety, ignoring warnings about explosive materials at the port.

sections.title: PORT RESPONSIBILITY
content: Charged with negligence by the judicial investigator for failing to secure the port despite knowing of the danger.
Refused to appear for questioning, protected by the 'immunity' granted by his political allies.

edmond-fadel.name: Edmond Fadel
edmond-fadel.summary: A long-serving security chief who operated in the shadows during critical periods of instability. His tenure saw the rise of extremist groups and complex security challenges. Like many in the security apparatus, he maintained the delicate balance between state duties and sectarian red lines.
edmond-fadel.quote: Intelligence is knowing what to ignore.

sections.title: THE SECURITY BLACK BOX
content: Managed the army's intelligence wing during the spillover of the Syrian war into Lebanon.
Criticized for the opacity of intelligence operations and the handling of Islamist detainees.

sections.title: SURVIVING THE PURGES
content: Navigated the treacherous political landscape to retain influence even after leaving office.
Represents the 'Deep State' security architecture that remains constant regardless of who is in government.

camille-daher.name: Camille Daher
camille-daher.summary: Succeeded Edmond Fadel as intelligence chief. His appointment was a subject of fierce political tug-of-war, highlighting how even sensitive security posts are divvied up like spoils of war. He continued the policy of 'security by consensus' rather than strict law enforcement.

sections.title: POLITICAL APPOINTMENT
content: His rise to the top of military intelligence was brokered by political deal-making rather than pure meritocracy.
Operated under the constraints of the 'sectarian balance' that prevents the army from confronting major militias.

sections.title: MANAGING CHAOS
content: Oversaw security during the height of the refugee crisis and border tensions.
Accused by activists of monitoring civil society movements rather than focusing solely on external threats.

najah-wakim.name: Najah Wakim
najah-wakim.summary: A veteran parliamentarian who wrote the seminal book 'Black Hands' (Al Ayadi Al Sawda) in the late 90s, documenting the corruption of the Hariri era when it was dangerous to do so. While controversial for his regional alignments, his early warnings about the debt-based economy and state looting proved fiercely accurate decades later.
najah-wakim.quote: I told you so thirty years ago.

sections.title: THE BLACK HANDS
content: Author of the best-selling book that first exposed the systemic looting of the state treasury by the post-war militia-business alliance.
Faced immense political pressure and legal threats for naming names when the 'reconstruction' myth was at its peak.

sections.title: THE ETERNAL OPPOSITION
content: A consistent critic of the 'Harirism' economic model that relied on high interest rates and debt.
His marginalization by the mainstream political class highlights how the system purges those who attack its financial roots.

charbel-nahas.name: Charbel Nahas
charbel-nahas.summary: The only minister to resign twice in protest against the system. An economist who predicted the financial crash with mathematical precision years in advance. As the head of 'Citizens in a State,' he advocates for a total secular transition, rejecting the sectarian regime entirely. He is the technocrat who refused to compromise.
charbel-nahas.quote: Legitimacy does not come from the sects, but from the state.

sections.title: RESIGNATION IN PROTEST
content: Resigned as Minister of Labor after the cabinet refused to implement his plan for universal healthcare and fair wages.
Blocked the signing of decrees he deemed illegal during his tenure as Telecom Minister, clashing with the entrenched elite.

sections.title: DIAGNOSING THE COLLAPSE
content: Argued for decades that the bank-centric economy was a Ponzi scheme designed to transfer wealth from the public to a few oligarchs.
His political movement (MMFID) offers one of the few comprehensive—albeit radical—roadmaps for a transition of power.

wafic-safa.name: Wafic Safa
wafic-safa.summary: The head of Hezbollah's Liaison and Coordination Unit. He is the party's main channel to the Lebanese state and foreign diplomats. Sanctioned by the US, he is infamous for allegedly threatening the Port Blast judge, Tarek Bitar, right inside the Palace of Justice.

sections.title: THREATENING JUSTICE
content: Allegedly sent a message to Judge Bitar: 'We will uproot you,' a threat that preceded the suspension of the investigation.
Acts as the enforcer who ensures that state institutions do not cross the party's red lines.

sections.title: SANCTIONED INTERMEDIARY
content: Sanctioned by the US Treasury for exploiting Lebanon's ports and borders to smuggle contraband.
Controls the 'parallel customs' that allows the party to bypass state taxes and oversight.

sobhi-tabbara.name: Sobhi Tabbara
sobhi-tabbara.summary: A prominent lawyer often tasked with representing the state in its most controversial cases. He has been criticized for defending the interests of the political establishment under the guise of defending the 'State,' particularly in cases involving financial crimes and the port explosion, effectively acting as a legal shield for the regime.
sobhi-tabbara.quote: I defend the institution, not the individual.

sections.title: DEFENDING THE ESTABLISHMENT
content: Represented the Lebanese State in legal battles against foreign companies and internal corruption probes, often prioritizing the regime's image over accountability.
His legal maneuvers are seen by critics as tactics to delay justice and bury sensitive files in endless litigation.

sections.title: CONFLICT OF INTEREST
content: Accused of navigating the fine line between private practice and public representation, serving the very officials who appointed him.
Part of the legal circle that drafts the loopholes allowing politicians to evade prosecution.

abbas-ibrahim.name: Abbas Ibrahim
abbas-ibrahim.summary: The man who was everywhere. As General Security chief, he acted as a diplomat, hostage negotiator, and politician. Despite his 'clean' image, he was charged in the Port Blast investigation but refused to appear, shielded by the Ministry of Interior.
abbas-ibrahim.quote: I am the bridge between all contradictions.

sections.title: ABOVE THE LAW
content: Issued an arrest warrant by Judge Bitar, which the Interior Minister refused to execute.
Used his diplomatic connections to market himself as indispensable to the West, buying immunity at home.

sections.title: THE DEALMAKER
content: Broker of shady deals involving oil imports and security arrangements.
His tenure solidified General Security as a political power base rather than just an administrative agency.

hassan-diab.name: Hassan Diab
hassan-diab.summary: The technocrat who presided over the default and the explosion. Diab claimed to be fighting corruption but ended up as a shield for the ruling class. He is the first PM to be charged with negligence in the port case, a charge he dismisses as politically motivated targeting of the Sunni position.
hassan-diab.quote: I did not know the danger.

sections.title: THE DEFAULT
content: Oversaw the first sovereign default in Lebanon's history without a backup plan, accelerating the currency's freefall.
His government was paralyzed by the very parties that appointed him.

sections.title: PORT NEGLIGENCE
content: Admitted to knowing about the ammonium nitrate prior to the blast but 'forgot' or was told it was safe.
Resigned in the wake of the explosion but continued as caretaker PM, doing little to address the crisis.

rakan-nasreddine.name: Rakan Nasreddine
rakan-nasreddine.summary: A figure representing the mid-level bureaucracy that enables the system's dysfunction. Often cited in proposed government lineups or administrative roles, figures like him represent the 'technocratic facade' used to cover political quotas.

sections.title: THE COG IN THE MACHINE
content: Represents the thousands of civil servants appointed through sectarian quotas rather than merit.
Part of the administrative state that processes corruption rather than preventing it.

sections.title: SILENT COMPLICITY
content: Operates in the background, ensuring the paperwork for the corrupt deals is technically correct.
The banality of evil in administrative form.

imad-ousman.name: Imad Ousman
imad-ousman.summary: Head of the Internal Security Forces. He famously refused to execute the arrest warrant against Riad Salameh, physically blocking State Security from entering Salameh's home. He represents the security forces acting as private guards for the elite.
imad-ousman.quote: I take my orders from politics, not judges.

sections.title: BLOCKING JUSTICE
content: Personally intervened to prevent the arrest of the Central Bank Governor, citing 'instability'.
Prosecuted by Judge Ghada Aoun for obstruction of justice, but shielded by the Prime Minister.

sections.title: SECTARIAN LOYALTY
content: His loyalty to the Future Movement often superseded his duty to the judiciary.
Transformed the ISF into a partisan tool in the political battles.

jean-kahwaji.name: Jean Kahwaji
jean-kahwaji.summary: The former Army Commander who was indicted for illicit enrichment. Investigators found millions of dollars in his bank accounts that could not be explained by his official salary. He symbolizes the corruption that even reached the military, the country's most trusted institution.
jean-kahwaji.quote: The uniform did not protect the integrity.

sections.title: ILLICIT ENRICHMENT
content: One of eight retired officers charged with accumulating vast wealth through corrupt means.
Allegedly used his position to secure contracts and favors for associates.

sections.title: EROSION OF TRUST
content: His indictment shook the public's faith in the military establishment.
Proved that the 'corruption virus' had infected the security sector deeply.

abdel-rahman-mabsout.name: Abdel Rahman Mabsout
abdel-rahman-mabsout.summary: The lone wolf terrorist who attacked Tripoli in 2019. A former ISIS member who had been detained and released, his rampage exposed the failures of the judicial and rehabilitation systems. He represents the violent blowback of the state's security failures.
abdel-rahman-mabsout.quote: The system creates its own monsters.

sections.title: SECURITY FAILURE
content: Released from prison despite known extremist ties, only to launch a deadly attack months later.
His case highlighted the lack of coordination and the revolving door of Lebanese prisons.

sections.title: THE VIOLENT END
content: Killed four security personnel before blowing himself up.
A grim reminder of the radicalization festering in the country's neglected peripheries.

joker-chaos.name: Systemic Chaos
joker-chaos.summary: The wildcard that trumps all plans. It represents the unpredictability of living in a failed state—hyperinflation, sudden blackouts, stray bullets, and the total absence of a safety net. It is the daily reality of the Lebanese citizen.
joker-chaos.quote: Expect the worst, and it will still surprise you.

sections.title: TOTAL COLLAPSE
content: The erasure of savings, hopes, and futures.
The rule of the jungle replacing the rule of law.

joker-meddling.name: Foreign Meddling
joker-meddling.summary: The invisible hand that moves the cards. Whether from the West or the East, foreign powers have always treated Lebanon as a proxy battlefield. This card represents the fact that the true decision-makers are often not even in the deck.

sections.title: PROXY WARS
content: Decisions made in Tehran, Washington, Riyadh, or Paris that determine the fate of Beirut.
The eternal curse of being a small country in a dangerous neighborhood.

FAQPage.title: FOIRE AUX QUESTIONS
FAQPage.description: Comprendre les complexités de l'influence du Hezbollah, la politique américaine et la voie vers un Liban souverain.

q1.question: Quelles stratégies spécifiques le Hezbollah a-t-il utilisées sous sa nouvelle direction pour montrer qu'il peut rebondir après le conflit ?
q1.answer: La direction du Hezbollah s'est appuyée sur de multiples fronts pour maintenir sa pertinence. Militairement, ils utilisent des événements spécifiques (comme des escalades à la frontière syrienne) pour montrer que le commandement central est toujours aux commandes. Politiquement, ils tirent parti de leur alliance avec Nabih Berri pour influencer les nominations et la formation du gouvernement. Dans les médias, ils restent agressifs contre les responsables de l'État, et ils utilisent l'appareil judiciaire et sécuritaire pour terroriser les opposants qui s'élèvent contre leurs armes ou les processus de paix.

q2.question: Quels moyens alternatifs le Hezbollah a-t-il trouvés pour financer ses opérations ?
q2.answer: Le Hezbollah dépend fortement de la contrebande d'argent liquide. Cela se produit dans une moindre mesure par l'aéroport, mais principalement par le port de Beyrouth et les passages frontaliers légaux et illégaux avec la Syrie.

q3.question: Comment le soutien financier de l'Iran affecte-t-il le Hezbollah et comment les États-Unis devraient-ils réagir ?
q3.answer: Bien que le soutien iranien soit essentiel, le Hezbollah exploite également un réseau de type 'mafieux' impliquant le trafic de drogue et le blanchiment d'argent. Ils vendent des produits importés à prix réduit en contrôlant les douanes au port de Beyrouth pour échapper aux taxes. De plus, les institutions locales du secteur privé dans les secteurs financiers leur rapportent des revenus. La réponse américaine doit impliquer une pression des autorités monétaires locales pour fermer ces entreprises.

q4.question: Quelles réformes sont nécessaires pour réduire l'influence du Hezbollah ?
q4.answer: La réforme commence par la libération des actifs appartenant à l'État, similaire aux améliorations récentes à l'aéroport. Le port de Beyrouth doit être libéré du contrôle partisan et les passages frontaliers officiels avec la Syrie doivent être strictement surveillés. De plus, les appareils de sécurité, de l'armée et judiciaire doivent être purgés des agents du Hezbollah pour restaurer la souveraineté de l'État.

q5.question: Quelles mesures devraient être prises pour élargir et appliquer les sanctions contre le Hezbollah ?
q5.answer: Les sanctions devraient viser l'ensemble de l'écosystème aidant le Hezbollah, y compris les établissements politiques, sécuritaires, diplomatiques et médiatiques. Une pression de haut niveau doit être exercée sur le gouvernement libanais pour démanteler l'infrastructure militaire et sécuritaire du Hezbollah et sa capacité à intimider les opposants internes.

q6.question: Comment les agences américaines peuvent-elles se coordonner pour relever les défis de gouvernance et de sécurité au Liban ?
q6.answer: Une approche multi-agences est requise : la DEA doit continuer de cibler les routes du trafic de drogue. Le département du Trésor doit sanctionner agressivement les alliés du Hezbollah (politiciens, juges, personnalités médiatiques) et tracer le blanchiment d'argent, tout en faisant pression pour des saisies d'actifs en Europe, aux États-Unis et en Afrique. Enfin, le ministère de la Justice devrait émettre des mandats d'arrêt contre les individus profondément impliqués dans la propagande et la facilitation de la sécurité du Hezbollah.

q7.question: Comment renforcer les partenariats internationaux pour contrer le Hezbollah ?
q7.answer: Une pression maximale doit être exercée sur tous les partenaires internationaux pour inscrire officiellement les ailes militaire et politique du Hezbollah comme organisations terroristes. Cela devrait être suivi par l'ajout progressif de tous les partis et entités alliés à ces listes terroristes pour isoler l'organisation à l'échelle mondiale.
